intro: Seriola aethnensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean seriola, is a species of fish rather than a plant, so it does not have botanical aspects. It belongs to the family Serranidae and is found in the Mediterranean Sea. This fish is characterized by its streamlined body and silver coloration. It is a pelagic species that typically inhabits coastal waters. Due to its ecological and economic importance, it is often targeted by fisheries in the region.
